In Maxmap's ongoing Reddit AMA, it was confirmed that the procedural asteroid ring around Dres was the easter egg he had the two-month bet on.

> 
> Well now that the cat is out of the proverbial bag, the Dres asteroid ring was an idea we had during development. It served a couple of purposes - first, Dres was one sad and lonely place, so it needed some love. Also, I liked the idea of having a static asteroid ring where players could do some pretty epic asteroid mining operations. Side note - looks like you folks absolutely destroyed my two month bet on how soon you would discover Dres had a procedural asteroid ring

I'll say we destroyed it- it was found the day before release, not two months after!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-26T23:47:15Z" title="04/26/2015 11:47  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 26, 2015</time> by DuoDex**
  
fixed your quote cause OCD :)
That's hilarious! How exactly was it discovered though? While I can see it in the reddit, where did that guy get the info from?
![57558473.jpg](http://cdn.meme.am/instances/500x/57558473.jpg)
Any images?

OK, so the easter egg that was supposed to be discovered in no less than two months after release actually was revealed 4 days before the release by a dev in the official twitch channel? ...

It is just me that thinks this makes any sane person head spin ? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

P.S. And before people ask, Maxmaps told about the asteroids around Dres in a KSP-TV stream last Friday ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

That's hilarious! Easter egg found one day \*before\* release ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Honestly, I'm not sure that even the asteroids make Dres worth more than a scientific visit.

 Fuel is like real estate; location determines the value.

Best,

-Slashy
Im expecting a horde of drilling spacecraft coming to Dres by tommorow. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

So that's what the new thing around Dres is all about. The KSP TV was completely full of people asking streamers to take a look at Dres, and I admit i put my fair share of requests in as well. Now the truth is revealed.

> 
> Im expecting a horde of drilling spacecraft coming to Dres by tommorow. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Just chillin' in deep space, being the quiet planet, enjoying your elbow room. No spacecrafts bothering you.

Wait! A sudden ring of asteroids? Oh well, I'm fine with them. But what's this... NOOOOO

***SUDDENLY SWARMED BY DRILLING SPACECRAFT***

> 
> That's hilarious! Easter egg found one day \*before\* release ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

But, for any eeloo mission, or even a jool mission, it's in a great place for refueling.

Thats nice that there are more potatoroids on other planets. Now there is an actyual reason to go to dres besides going there just to claim you made it to dres and back. Also, im SO making a asteroid colony in dres orbit, space dogfights in asteroid fields FTW!

> Wait! A sudden ring of asteroids? Oh well, I'm fine with them. But what's this... NOOOOO
>

Nah, I'm pretty sure Dres will be happy about the fact that it's no longer just a filler object to make the space between Duna and Jool prettier in map view. And I was planning to start a long-term colonization of Dres later on!
How many moons does it have now?

> 
> How many moons does it have now?

Probably lots and lots. I place my money on above 50.
Not moons, Brotoro. KSP gained a bona fide procedural asteroid field around Dres orbit ...
So these aren't in orbit around Dres?
No, they orbit the Sun, just near Dres orbit. In other words, Dres now in a somewhat in game Ceres analog .
I've never gone to Dres. Now I suppose I have a fun reason to!
This sounds more like a feature than an easter egg. Not that I'm complaining.

> 
> So these aren't in orbit around Dres?

Not yet...

Prize for the first person to create an asteroid-based Dyson shell around Dres?

> 
> Not yet...
> Prize for the first person to create an asteroid-based Dyson shell around Dres?

I betcha Whackjob'll do it. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
In the picture from the stream they were in orbit though. Was that a coincidence or did the guy put them in orbit himself?

I asked the same question earlier today and it seems Dres is not orbiting in an asteroid field and the asteroids are occasionally entering its sphere of influence just like what happens with Kerbin. Thankfully, they don't spawn in closed orbits around Dres, i.e. they are not procedurally spawned natural satellites. I really wouldn't like that.
Oh, so THAT was the Easter egg? It just seemed like a regular old new feature to me. Well there goes that excitement xP
